meanings.definition: The quality or state of being illiberal.
meanings.sent1: Her illiberalness towards new ideas hindered progress in the team.
meanings.sent2: The illiberalness of the dictator's regime stifled freedom of speech.
meanings.sent3: Despite her illiberalness towards spicy food, she tried a bite of the hot chili.
meanings.sent4: The illiberalness of his views created a wall between him and those with different opinions.
meanings.sent5: The illiberalness of the policy was evident in its strict enforcement.

meanings.sent1: The illiberalness of his attitude made it difficult for him to accept diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent2: Her illiberalness towards change made it challenging for the team to innovate.
meanings.sent3: Despite his illiberalness towards horror movies, he agreed to watch one with his friends.
meanings.sent4: The illiberalness of the community towards outsiders was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The illiberalness of his behavior alienated those around him.

meanings.definition: Restrictive or narrow-minded beliefs or attitudes.
meanings.sent1: The illiberalness of his thinking limited his ability to see different perspectives.
meanings.sent2: Her illiberalness towards unconventional ideas stifled creativity in the group.
meanings.sent3: Despite his illiberalness towards modern technology, he reluctantly learned to use a smartphone.
meanings.sent4: The illiberalness of their traditions clashed with the changing world.
meanings.sent5: The illiberalness of his mindset kept him from exploring new opportunities.
